sections.title: Quick Facts
chunks: Most recent role: Research Assistant at Rutgers University (Aug 2023 – Jan 2025).
Current status: M.S. student in Data Science at Rutgers University.
Primary focus: data science, biostatistics, research tooling.

sections.title: Experience — Rutgers Research Assistant
chunks: Built Python analysis pipeline for rodent auditory decision-making behavioral data; implemented drift diffusion modeling (DDM), statistical inference, and pose-tracking with angle analysis.

Built pipeline for neural recordings from electrode implants in auditory and parietal cortices; mapped electrode configuration/data to binary, spike sorting into units, developed decoders using SVM and pattern matching to predict behavior from neural activity; ran statistical analyses and linear regression.
Created schematics/visuals in Adobe Illustrator and Python; contributed to papers, posters, presentations; wrote papers and fellowship applications.

sections.title: Experience — Georgia Tech Research Institute
chunks: Performed qualitative content analysis (QCA) and frequency analyses on books, historic interview transcripts, and papers on cultural trauma/history and ontological security in Russia/Ukraine and group interactions in extremist groups.
Mined online data from Russian press releases/websites; assisted ML protocol in Python; visualized data using Adobe CC.

sections.title: Projects
chunks: Projects (from resume): Portfolio Optimization Dashboard (Streamlit), Dose-Response Curve Dashboard (BMS Challenge), CODA (Hack GT 9 ASL rhythm game), and an Alzheimer’s Assessment CNN project.

Portfolio Optimization Dashboard (project, Dec 2025): built a Streamlit dashboard where investors can optimize a stock portfolio with customizable risk aversion, transaction cost, and risk‑free rate parameters.

Portfolio Optimization Dashboard (project): implemented models including XGBoost, Random Forest, PCA, and CatBoost; trained on Yahoo! Finance data via API calls; resume notes XGBoost outperformed the SPY index by 4.17% in Sept 2025.

Dose‑Response Curve Dashboard (project, Dec 2025; BMS Challenge at Rutgers): built a Streamlit dashboard to simulate dose‑response curves using multiple models (2-, 4-, 5‑parameter logistic; linear) with customizable parameters.
Dose‑Response Curve Dashboard (project): added features to save and compare curves and to suggest optimal dilution schemes using squared‑error anchors and linear‑region coverage.

CODA (project; Hack GT 9, Oct 2022): team of 4 built an interactive rhythm game to help learn American Sign Language (ASL) using computer vision to recognize and track hand movements; built with Python, Figma, and Unity; won 2nd place overall (out of 900+ participants, 191 projects).

Alzheimer’s Assessment (project, May 2023): built a convolutional neural network to assess Alzheimer’s severity from CT scans; used preprocessing techniques including oversampling, cropping, PCA, and categorization; explored architectures including ResNet, AlexNet, and PCANet.
Alzheimer’s Assessment (project): used Matplotlib for performance visualizations and LaTeX to illustrate model architecture (per resume).
